content:
{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-364-12-B |Item_parent=Fractures in children: epidemiological, diagnostic and therapeutic features |Item_parent_short=Fractures in children: epidemiological, diagnostic and therapeutic features |Rank=B |Title=Know how to diagnose complications of ankle fractures |Description=Know the risk of growth problems due to epiphysiodesis |Section=Follow-up and/or prognosis |Contributors= |Order=12}} Be aware of the high risk of epiphysiodesis after ankle epiphyseal detachment fractures in adolescents. Be aware of the risk of subsequent growth problems
.

question.question: What is a potential complication of ankle fractures in adolescents?
question.option_b: Epiphysiodesis, which can lead to growth problems
